quiz.text: Fiscal deficit is identified as
options: Total borrowings of the government
Total outlay – income received
Budget deficit – public borrowing
Revenue deficit + Primary deficit
None of the above

quiz.text: A term financial liberalisation is concerned with
options: Control by the RBI
Decontrol and Deregulation of financial system in an economy
Only decontrolling interest rate structure
Asset-liability efficient management of nationalised banks
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are treated as artificial currency?
options: ADR
GDR
SDR
IDR
Both ADR and SDR

quiz.text: When the Reserve Bank of India announces an increase of the Cash Reserve Rate, what does it mean?
options: The commercial banks will have less money to lend
The Reserve Bank of India will have less money to lend
The Union Government will have less money to lend
The commercial banks will have more money to lend
None of the above

quiz.text: The lowering of Bank Rate by the Reserve Bank of India leads to
options: More liquidity in the market
Less liquidity in the market
No change in the liquidity in the market
Mobilization of more deposits by commercial banks
None of the above

quiz.text: Priority Sector Lending by banks in India constitutes the lending to
options: Agriculture
Micro and Small enterprises
Weaker sections
Social infastructure
All of the above

quiz.text: In the context of Indian economy, 'Open Market Operations' refers to
options: Borrowing by scheduled banks from the RBI
Lending by commercial banks to industry and trade
Purchase and sale of government securities by the RBI
Both A and B
None of the above

quiz.text: 'Basel III Accord' or simply 'Basel III', often seen in the news, seeks to
options: Develop national strategies for the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity
Improve banking sector's ability to deal with financial and economic stress and improve risk management
Reduce the greenhouse gas emissions but places a heavier burden on developed countries
Transfer technology from developed countries to poor countries to enable them to replace the use of chlorofluorocarbons in refrigeration with harmless chemicals
Strengthen the corporate bond Market

quiz.text: Which of the following is a most likely consequences of implementing the 'Unified Payments Interface (UPI)'?
options: Mobile wallets will not be necessary for online payments.
Digital currency will totally replace the physical currency in about two decades.
FDI inflows will drastically increase.
Direct transfer of subsidies to poor people will become very effective.
None of the above

quiz.text: Which one of the following links all the ATMs in India?
options: Indian Bankers' Associations
National Securities Depository Limited
National Payments Corporation of India
Reserve Bank of India
State Bank of India

quiz.text: Which of the following is not the subsidiary of RBI ?
options: DICGC
ReBIT
BRBNMPL
IFTAS
NABARD

quiz.text: Which of the following is not part of Monetary Policy ?
options: CRR
SLR
Repo Rate
Open Market Operations
Bank Rate

quiz.text: Which one of the following statements correctly describes the meaning of legal tender money?
options: The money which is tendered in courts of law to defray the fee of legal cases
The money which a creditor is under compulsion to accept in settlement of his claims
The bank money in the form of cheques, drafts, bills of exchange, etc.
The metallic money in circulation in country.
None of the above

quiz.text: The money multiplier in an economy increases with
options: Increase in the cash reserve ratio
Increase in the banking habit of the population
Increase in the statutory liquidity ratio
Increase in the population of the country
Increase in Human capital of the Country

quiz.text: The Chairmen of public sector banks are selected by the
options: Banks Board Bureau
Reserve Bank of India
Union Ministry of Finance
Management of concerned bank
Central Government

quiz.text: Which of the following is not included in the assets of a commercial bank in India?
options: Advances
Deposits
Investments
Money at call and short notice
Cash in hand

quiz.text: Assertion (A) : Devaluation can correct imbalance in the Balance of Payments. Reason (R) : Devaluation raises the price of imported goods and reduces the foreign price of exports of the devaluating country.
options: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
(A) is true, but (R) is false.
(A) is false, but (R) is true.
None of the above

quiz.text: Mark the option having the right chronological order : (i) Introduction of Special Drawing Rights (ii) Introduction of Euro (iii) Introduction of Gold Standard Mechanism (iv) Introduction of Multilateral Trading System
options: (ii) (iii) (iv) (i)
(iii) (ii) (i) (iv)
(iii) (i) (ii) (iv)
(i) (iii) (ii) (iv)
(iii) (iv) (i) (ii)

quiz.text: The concept of GST is originated in
options: France
Britain
United States
Germany
India

quiz.text: A redistribution of income in a country can be best brought about through
options: Progressive taxation combined with progressive expenditure
Progressive taxation combined with regressive expenditure
Regressive taxation combined with regressive expenditure
Regressive taxation combined with progressive expenditure
None of the above

quiz.text: Assertion (A): Fiscal deficit is greater than budgetary deficit. Reason (R): Fiscal deficit is the borrowing from the Reserve Bank of India plus other liabilities of the Government to meet its expenditure.
options: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not a correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true
None of the above

quiz.text:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists 
List I
 List II
A. Fiscal deficit1. Excess of Total Expenditure over Total Receipts
B. Budget deficit2. Excess of Revenue Expenditure
C. Revenue deficit3. Total Borrowings of the government
D. Primary deficit4. Excess of Total Expenditure over Total Receipts less borrowings and Interest Payments
options: A-3; B-1; C-2; D-4
A-4; B-3; C-2; D-1
A-1; B-3; C-2; D-4
A-3; B-1; C-4; D-2
A-2; B-4; C-1; D-3

quiz.text: All revenues received by the Union Government by way of taxes and other receipts for the conduct of Government business are credited to the _________?
options: Contingency Fund of India
Public Account
Consolidated Fund of India
Deposits and Advances Fund
Reserve Fund

quiz.text: Which one of the following statements appropriately describes the ‘fiscal stimulus"?
options: It is a massive investment by the Government in manufacturing sector to ensure the supply of goods to meet the demand surge caused by rapid economic growth
It is an intense affirmative action of the Government to boost economic activity in the country.
It is Government's intensive action on financial institutions to ensure disbursement of loans to agriculture and allied sectors to promote greater food production and contain food inflation
It is an extreme affirmative action by the Government to pursue its policy of financial inclusion.
It is large scale pumping of money in banking sector.

quiz.text: It is generally calculated as a percentage of the value of the property, rather than on size, weight, or quantity. What type of tax is referred to here?
options: Double taxation
Specific tax
Single Tax
Advalorem Tax
Tobin Tax

quiz.text: Incidence of tax means
options: Initial resting place of the burden of tax
Final resting place of the burden of tax
Both A and B
It refers to tax evasion
None of these

quiz.text: In India, deficit financing is used for raising resources for
options: Economic development
Redemption of public debt
Adjusting the balance of payments
Reducing the foreign debt
Distributing free resources

quiz.text: Public Expenditure increases
options: Interest rate
Employment
Exports
Imports
None of the above

quiz.text: Along with the Budget, the finance minister also places other documents before the Parliament which include ‘The Macro Economic Framework Statement’. The aforesaid documents are presented because this is mandated by
options: Long standing parliamentary/convention
Article 112 and Article 110(1) of the Constitution of India
Article 113 of the Constitution of India
Provisions of Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management Act, 2003
None of the above

quiz.text:
The Fiscal Responsibility and Budget Management (FRBM) Act aimed for
  1. Eliminating both revenue deficit and fiscal deficit
  2. Giving flexibility to RBI for inflation management
  3. The Medium-term Fiscal Policy Statement  sets out three-year rolling targets for four specific fiscal indicators in relation to the gross domestic product (GDP) at market prices.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: Only 1 and 2
Only 2 and 3
Only 1 and 3
Only 1
All  of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding Fiscal Policy:
  1. It helps to maintain the economy’s growth rate so that certain economic goals can be achieved.
  2. It aims to achieve full employment, or near full employment, as a tool to recover from low economic activity.
  3. There are three tools of Fiscal policy.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 1 only
Only 1 and 2
Only 1 and 3
Only 2 and 3
All of the above

quiz.text: Fiscal policy in India is formulated by
options: Reserve Bank of India
Planning Commission
Finance Ministry
Securities and Exchange Board of India
NABARD

quiz.text: If we deduct grants to states for the creation of capital assets from revenue deficit, we arrive at
options: Primary defecit
Net fiscal deficit
Budgetary deficit
Effective revenue deficit
None of the above

quiz.text: Which one of the following is a capital receipt in government budget?
options: Interest receipts on loans given by the government to other parties
Dividends and profits from public sector undertakings
Borrowing of the government from public
Income tax receipts
Challans

quiz.text: John M. Keynes is best known for advocating:
options: A policy of annually balancing the budget.
Deficit spending during some recessions.
Contractionary fiscal policy during a recession.
Expansionary fiscal policy during a boom.
Free distribution of resources

quiz.text: Which of the following is the best example of an automatic stabilizer in fiscal policy?
options: Spending more on national highways.
Paying pensions to retired military personnel.
Paying unemployment insurance benefits.
Decreasing the supply of money.
None of the above

quiz.text: All of the following are variables that can be manipulated to affect fiscal policy except:
options: Personal income taxes.
Government expenditures on goods and services.
Government expenditures on unemployment benefits.
The rate of interest.
None of the above

quiz.text: Contractionary fiscal policy can involve:
options: Increasing consumption and investment and taxes.
Decreasing government spending and increasing taxes.
Increasing government spending and increasing taxes.
Decreasing interest rate and money supply
None of the above.

quiz.text: Changes in discretionary fiscal policy (e.g., taxes) and automatic stabilizers (e.g., unemployment insurance benefits) can have significant unintended effects on all of the following except:
options: The incentive to work
The incentive to spend
The incentive to save
The incentive to purchase imported goods
None of the above

quiz.text: To help fight a recession, the government could
options: Lower interest rates by decreasing the cash rate.
Decrease taxes to increase aggregate demand.
Conduct contractionary fiscal policy by raising taxes.
Decrease government spending to balance the budget
None of the above
